title: i feel like the witchhunting/nameshaming rule is unnecessary
body:
when was the last time boards actually witch hunted a random even after evidence they are inting/trolling/flaming for a long while?

people don't care about randoms enough to witchhunt them, if you bring them up you'll get ignored downvoted and reminded to just report them

but a HATED FAMOUS STREAMER WAS OVERLY TOXIC FOR ONE GAME? that kind of posts hits front page and slips through the witchhunting rule

so what's the name shaming rule trying to prevent exactly? kinda confused here
